title: Data Analysis: Residual Plots
question_text: Which of the following statements is/are true concerning residual plots? I. A residual plot is constructed by plotting the explanatory variable values on the $x$ -axis against the residuals on the $y$ -axis. II. A residual plot should have a positive slope if the slope of the least squares regression line is above zero. III. A residual plot shows how the errors in a linear regression model are arranged.
